Soup's On!

You find yourself at a quaint and idyllic inn. The sights and smells are all perfect to rest your weary bones. But the hairs on the back of your neck stand on end as your sixth-sense tells you something is wrong.

The Cook at the Crossroads is a drop-in adventure that can be used in any MÖRK BORG campaign or as a one-shot. Depending on playstyle this adventure should last anywhere from 2-3 hours.

The Cook at the Crossroads includes:

An open ended adventure scenario that allows the players freedom to do as they wish.
A fantasy-horror scenario suitable for MÖRK BORG.
A mystery to be solved.
A horrible fate worse than death.

boardgame.name: War Powers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some Heroes are born with their powers, others are gifted with amazing abilities. But then there are those who have to earn their powers through hard work, regimented training and a mastery of arms. Like the heroes of D-Day, the knights of old or the star-warriors of some far future empire, these Heroes define their abilities in terms of blood, guts and bullets. Those Heroes defined through martial prowess over superpowered endowment trace their legacy back through comic book history. In those pages one can find the glorious four-colored stories about the brave soldiers of World War Two, the barbarian adventurers of a forgotten age, the valiant knights of Camelot, grim urban vigilantes, cowboys and countless others who now stand alongside spandex clad supers.

This sourcebook contains:

Expanded War Descriptors and War Features
Offensive Powers: Hand-to-hand Expert,Guns & Ammo, Sniper and two more powers
Defensive Powers: Body Armor, Stealth Training and one more power
Movement Powers: Ace, Driller and Trench Stormer
Utility Powers: Arsenal, Recon Tech, and one more power
Other Powers: Survivalist
War Complications: Disability,Grizzled, Politicized and two more complications

boardgame.name: Arcmage: New Horizons
boardgame.description:
The thrid core set of our libre fantasy style strategic card game Arcmage.

As you battle your opponents summoning creatures and casting spells, you’ll have to defend your cities, manage your resources and power supply and conjure up a strategical plan to beat your opponents. Will you be the one that brings order to the warring factions in Irdiya? Will you challenge all and utter the words ‘Amin duna, ilya lanta’?

This turn based game allows a player to gather resources, build cities, cast and move creatures, recruit an army, play magic spells or interrupt an opponents' play. Each turn the player may launch an attack on an a target city. On opponents' turns players may have to bravely defend their cities against the marauding enemy's army. Lose all of your cities and you're out of the game.

Following the tradition of many great CCG's, the game supports both casual as in depth strategic game play. Furthermore it offers an unique resource system and adds a spacial dimension that lets the player decide how and where to deploy their creatures.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Axon Protocol
boardgame.description:
Axon Protocol [AP] is a cyberpunk themed game of corporate warfare and brain hacking. You are a powerful hacker in the ranks of an international Mega-Corporation.

Your job: hack into the brains of innocent citizens and manipulate their behavior.

Your goal: wring as many resources out of the city as possible and maximize your corporations profit, no matter the cost. Time and timing is crucial. Enemy hackers will fight you every step of the way, and at some point the city will reach its limits and collapse under the corporate struggle.
Chaos and anarchy will follow. It doesn’t matter. You got the most out of it. And there is always another city.
It’s all in the name of profit.

Axon Protocol is a for 1-6 players and features a unique game mechanic called “Shared worker control”.
Every single character in the city has their own routine and skills. Each character can be hacked and controlled by every player.
But they will follow their own behavior again the moment no one is hacking them. The Rockstar might give a concert in the city plaza, until a terrorist blows it up, and the corporate rescue team can only save one of the victims.
The game features 6 types of resources: augments, data, drugs, products, scandals and violence. Each corporation profits from two of these resources.
With over 40 unique characters and 6 different corporations each with their own unique special ability, every game of Axon Protocol will tell its own story.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Flames of Freedom: Quickstart
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It is the dawn of the American Revolutionary War of 1776. A tangled web of conspiracy spans North America. In the war for survival, it does not matter what your creed, color, culture or gender is – all stand together. Thomas Paine’s Common Sense is held aloft in every Rebel patriot’s hand, as they take up arms against the British Empire. But as the Revolution has begun, something far more mysterious stirs...

Flames of Freedom: Grim & Perilous RPG is an American gothic horror game set in 1776 North America, powered by the Zweihänder RPG engine. Experience Flames of Freedom before its formal release in July 2021 by downloading the free Quickstart. It comes equipped with 32 pages of game rules, an 11 page adventure, 7 pre-generated characters, cut-out paper miniatures and a print-out map. It can be played one-on-one, but also supports up to 7 players and one gamemaster. The rules and adventure are designed for new gamers, providing a 2-3 hour play experience.

This Quickstart is an all-in-one game, and does not require any previous play experience with Zweihänder RPG.

boardgame.name: Dominion's End
boardgame.description:
From the Back Cover

All Must Fall

Upon gaining access to the hostile starship known as Ark Prime, the heroes find themselves immersed in propaganda designed to show the might and superiority of the ancient empire that launched the vessel eons ago. Only once they break free of the brainwashing can the fight past robots, holographic constructs, and alien supersoldiers awoken from statis to confront Ark Prime's evil AI. In the end, the heroes must decide what to do with hundreds of other sleeping citizens of a formerly dangerous civilization. Their decision could affect the future of the galaxy!

This Starfinder Adventure Path volume concludes the Devastation Ark Adventure Path and includes:


"Dominion's End" a Starfinder Adventure for 18th-level characters, bu Ron Lundeen.



A catalog of technological relics from the ancient sivv civilization, by Larry Wilhelm.



An archive of high-level alien creatures, including a powerful, transendant kasatha and a gargantuan deep-sea nightmare, by Sasha Laranoa Harving, Patchen Mortimer, and Ron Lundeen.



Statistics and deck plans for a massive robot-crewed carrier designed to collect data, by Ryan Gilmore, and a glimpse at a world enclosed by an impenetrable force shield by Robert G. McCreary.

boardgame.name: Mystic Vale: Evergreen
boardgame.description:
The Evergreen micro-expansion adds new advancement and vale cards to the base Mystic Vale game, giving players more card crafting power. Conclaves for Twilight Garden and Harmony expansions grant players the option to customize the starting decks of advancements and vales, creating a new play experience each game.

This will be available direct from AEG.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: BattleCON: Dolores Solo Fighter
boardgame.description:
Dolores’s wide-reaching attacks combine with the frightful power of the Wings of Malephaise, which allow her to move quickly around the board. Though her ranges are limited, her superior mobility and disruptive potential allow her to create deadly situations for her opponents.

Confound and corner your opponents to strike them down!

listing.notes: Title: BattleCON: Dolores Malephaise Publisher: Level 99 Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Roll-Z
boardgame.description:
Will you survive? Roll-Z is a Solo Survival Time Challenge, in Print and Play format, but with colorfull high definition PDF files, and that's not all! You will need the Oficial Game Aplication that not only complements game immersion, with chilling original music, sounds and graphics, it also enhance the gameplay WITH RANDOM ENCOUNTERS making it a REAL TIME CHALLENGE.

In Roll-Z you represent a survivor who must find pieces to fix the car, place them, and at the same time repel a horde of zombies trying to tear down your fragile barricade. Is not easy! If you manage to repair the old Chevy (by putting together the 5 necessary pieces) before time runs out, you have won, but if your barricade collapses or you run out of time, you will became another brainless wobblers.
TO SURVIVE, you will need to master all the resources of the game, from zombies to trash. With an easy to learn mechanic, and a deep fast paced tactic options, you get a replayable surviving game to play with all your friends. Challenge them all!

—description from the designer

listing.notes: It's a print-and-play game. You can pick the Base game and the Coop expansion for 3USD more. Im an official seller from Hecate, you can get the game in the official webpage, but Buy it here to give the BGG it's commission :D

boardgame.name: Das Elbespiel
boardgame.description:
The players travel from Dresden via Lobositz, Leitmeritz and Coswig to Dessau and back to Dresden. Movement is determined by a die. On some stations events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to arrive back in Dresden wins the Game.

The game was published for the 100th anniversary of commercial steamship tours on the river "Elbe".

—user summary

boardgame.name: Les Naufrageurs
boardgame.description:
Les naufrageurs is a game inspired by the legends or realities of the island of Oléron based on the looting of wrecked boats, authorized by the king, in bygone days.

Shipowners are trying to save their cargo (barrels of different values, kept secret from Naufrageurs until captured, if captured).
Shipowners assign barrels to each boat.
Les Naufrageurs d'Oléron (land pirates of Oléron) try to make ships beach and capture as much booty as possible.
Points are counted once the barrels have been used up.
Whoever got the most wins.

The game used homemade 3-sided "dice".

boardgame.name: Posthuman Saga: The Journey Home Expansion
boardgame.description:
In your quest to scope out the slave camps, you’ve gone deep into the mutant heartland, further than anyone from the Resistance has been in years. You’ve seen cruelty, horrors and tragedies that will stay with you for the rest of your days. It’s time to let your path take you back home, to the Fortress. It’ll be a long, eventful journey, taking you through uncharted territories. Along the way, you’ll have plenty of occasions to gather intel for the Resistance, help out strangers and allies you meet, strike another crucial blow or two in the war against the mutants, and garner even more renown before you walk back through the Fortress’ gates.

Posthuman Saga: The Journey Home adds several new mechanics and more alternate ways of scoring to the base game. Enjoy Posthuman as it was always intended, with more player interaction, evolving narrative missions and a heavier tactical experience.

The Journey Home also adds a lot of new content - pick from 2 new playable characters, recruit new followers, collect more weapons and equipment and fight your way through a nasty bunch of new mutants.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: CastleScape
boardgame.description:
The King has commissioned a magnificent Castle that will span the ages. The ones who build it will be blessed with riches, power, and Renown for all time. This is where you come in. To build a Castle require workers, and your Guild is ready to answer the call. You are one of the few, the clever, and the devious, who aims to scheme and expand power by any means necessary. Use care though; the King will visit the Castle and Inspect it to make sure that everything is to his liking. If he finds you have been participating in shady deals, he will strip your Guild of its Influence and resources. Claim credit for building his Castle and prove to him that you are the greatest Guild in the land.”

CastleScape is a deck-building area-control game set in medieval times. It is a time of Kings and Guilds, money and power, deception and influence. In CastleScape, each player represents one of four Guilds who are building a large castle, containing many Baileys, for the King. Players build Walls into Baileys, gather recruits to spread their Guild’s influence, spend gold, perform questionable deeds in the Back Alley, and complete Goals and Quests. However, they must balance their actions with how much Infamy and Corruption they will accrue from performing them. Whenever the King visits the Castle to inspect it, he will strip Influence from the Guilds based on their Infamy.

Each player begins the game with a basic deck of cards (gold, recruits, walls, and a few clumsy thieves) and a couple hidden goals. The game board starts with one wall in the center, and players must build outward, always adding walls adjacent to other walls. Whenever a Bailey is completed, Renown(points) will be awarded based on how large that Bailey is, and the player with the most Influence in that Bailey will claim the Renown. Starting in the same area and building outwards forces all players to have a high level of player interactivity and decision making so that no two games will ever feel the same. Inspections will remove significant amounts of Influence from the game board, giving players additional ways to influence how things play out.

CastleScape is highly strategic and incentivizes players to play differently each game. Besides each player’s hidden objective cards and a Castle that is procedurally built each game, players will plan multiple turns ahead to build the castle how they see fit. The Market also has both static and rotating card options to keep gameplay fresh and interesting. Points can be earned by building and claiming credit for Baileys, purchasing cards, and completing hidden or public goals; but points will be lost based on Corruption.

CastleScape has been created to give a fresh take on the Deck-builder genre, adding heavy player interaction on a central game board, with far more to think about than just what cards you want to purchase. It offers deep strategy, nearly unlimited replayability, and interesting/fun interactions and combos.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Picto Rush
boardgame.description:
The fastest-paced drawing game ever!

Players must scribble 20 drawings in 20 seconds! Indeed...that's only one second per drawing!

In each round, there is a different "Reader." They will read a list of 20 random words, and later, challenge each of the players (three times), to remember their own drawings!

On a player's turn, they get two points if they are able to figure out what their own drawing was. If they can't, an opponent may hit the bell and steal the answer...for 1 point.

The game ends when all players have been Reader one time.

boardgame.name: The Spy Game
The Spy Game Core Rulebook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take on Secret Missions and Covert Operations in a Clandestine World

Welcome Agent. Enter a world of international stealth and intrigue in a modern setting. Delve into a world of spies, assassins, diabolical masterminds and suave secret agents.

The Spy Game is an action & espionage roleplaying game book that uses the 5th Edition of the world's most famous roleplaying game rules. Peer behind the curtain of society into the world of the Agencies and take your place as a world class spy. Together with your crew of con-artists, specialists, infiltrators and hackers you will influence, subvert and overcome any challenge.

Will you topple corrupt governments or protect the interests of the highest bidder? Will you take out the target before they achieve their aims, or aid them? Will you counter worldwide threats, or become them yourselves? The Spy Game places your own intelligence agency on the world stage, where the promise of adventure waits for you!

Create your own spy stories of action and adventure in a covert world.
Build your own super spy as anything from a rough wilderness explorer to a tuxedoed charmer and everything in between.
Use a familiar gaming system in 5e, allowing new players to easily start and experienced players to get right into the action.
Engage and overcome a host of minions, villains, and evil genius NPCs.
Explore the world of The Spy Game and its agencies, colorful worldwide organizations engaged in every type of espionage in exotic locations.
Design complex plots and deadly missions for players to go on with the help of guidelines for Gamemasters new and old.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: The Spy Game: Roleplaying in a Covert World

listing.notes:
This is for the Kickstarter exclusive Secret Agent Special Edition of The Spy Game (5e).
New in Shrink https://imgur.com/a/9q5Tecb

boardgame.name: Math Fluxx 2.0 Upgrade Pack
boardgame.description:
Contains 15 new cards that have been included in Math Fluxx Version 2.0 and beyond, that can be added to the Version 1.0 deck. The cards replace 15 cards from the original deck.

Some Goals have been replaced with Actions of the same name, other Goals have had text alterations to make them clearer, and the two "Meta Rules Plan B" and "Plan C" have been replaced with one "Math Rule" Meta Rule.

boardgame.name: Old Bones
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A caravan of travelling priests murdered.

The bones of a long-dead saint stolen, claimed by barbarian marauders.

A monk desperate to see the ancient relics safely returned.

What’s so significant about a box of old bones?

The idea behind Parallel Adventures is that they can be slotted into most fantasy settings with little effort. The gamemaster should take the time to read through the adventure and decide on what changes are necessary to make it fit into their world. So, whether you are running a home-brew setting, Gloranth, or Forgotten Realms, the Parallel Adventure can slot right in.

As well as being setting-agnostic, parallel adventures are also systems-agnostic, and comes without any stat blocks. Depending on the power level of your player characters and your preferred system — be it Dungeon & Dragons 5e, Pathfinder or Savage Worlds — this is where you will have to do the most work. Prominent non-player characters feature a brief description that should serve as a guide to their capabilities, but you will have to do the rest.

boardgame.name: The Great Trial: Halloween
boardgame.description:
"The Great Trial: Halloween is a one-page adventure for 4 1st-level characters. It consists of a short dungeon designed specifically to challenge novice adventures. It's focused on the Exploration and Combat pillars, having only 3 Social opportunities.

Content
A 1st-level dungeon for 4 players that should thake 3 to 4 hours to run. It contains combat, traps and simple puzzles. You will find:

A high quality PNG file with the adventure containing:
The DM version of the map
Guidelines on how to run it
Mechanical descriptions of all rooms
Summarized background and endings
7 High Quality maps:
DM version (30x40 sq)
Player version (30x40 sq)
Player version - Gridless
Player version - Light (30x40 sq)
Player version - Gridless Light
Player version - Dark Light (30x40 sq)
Player version - Gridless Dark Light

Is your group up to this Challenge? Go find out!"

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Cepheus Journal (Issue 002)
boardgame.description:
From the Editors

This fanzine is to be a non­profit endeavour, no ads, no cost, written totally for the love of the game.

boardgame.name: Wondrous Patrons: The Ancestral Voice
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

While many Warlocks gain their power through some powerful entity or patron from another realm or plane, there are a handful of Warlocks born into families with powerful ancestors. And sometimes, those ancestors still have unfinished business in the mortal realm. These powerful ancestors will latch onto a descendant with promise or potential and then work through that descendant, giving this newly-formed warlock power and magic that is a remnant of what these powerful ancestors once had.

Maybe your family has a tradition of the youngest born gaining the power of an ancient elder? Maybe you discovered an ancient heirloom that contained the spirit of the long-dead archmage you descend from? Maybe you are part of a nefarious ritual to bring back the evil matriarch of your family, but it goes awry, and instead you gain the matriarch’s power, but also now have to deal with her nagging disembodied spirit at all times?

However your ancestors reconnect with you, their descendant, the arcane prowess you are now imbued with is very present. Utilizing your ancestor’s power and spiritual presence, you’re able to invoke their spirit to perform haunting actions that powerful spirits are known for. You can animate objects as if they were under the whim of a poltergeist, send the spirit of your ancestor to possess you enemies, or even recall history from beyond your time as if you once lived in a different era. This union between your ancestor and your own self makes you a potent warlock, indeed.

boardgame.name: Sunken Bones
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Storms regularly sweep through the Acid Sea, and they seem to rise up at the worst possible time. Dalmatian Cove is a known, but hidden, location where those harsh storms frequently sweep ships. Explore the cove and meet its residents in this adventure fraught with danger and opportunities for a hardy band of scallywags.

Sunken Bones is a story for fourth to fifth level characters, in which your crew will lose your ship to a natural disaster and then bargain for the resources to recover it. The Graveyard is one of the most dangerous places in Dalmatian Cove, but it isnít the only risky element at play. This story also provides opportunities for building relationships with key figures who make Dalmatian Cove their home and assists in uncovering some of their secrets.

This adventure is designed to be run as part of the "Going on the Account" chronicle detailed in Pirates of Pugmire. It is set after "The Race" and before "Heart of the Storm". However, it is possible to run this adventure completely independently of those stories.

boardgame.name: Heroes of the Far East: The Samurai
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The samurai is a warrior of great dedication and focus. A samurai's training in bushido, the way of the warrior, is an honor and a privilege to these soldiers. It is through this discipline that the bushi, another name for a samurai, earns the respect and the loyalty of his companions. It is through bushido that all things in life are viewed by samurai.

"I live with the teachings of bushido in my heart always. Loyalty to my lord is loyalty to my people and loyalty to myself."

The way of the samurai is one of discipline and tactical combat. Fighters, paladins, and even some rangers find the teachings of bushido close to their own ideals, and so dedicate themselves to their beliefs or to a tangible master. A warlord's already stalwart dedication to his companions lends itself well to life as a bushi. Whether to turn a new leaf or just learn some new tricks, there are rogues who might consider such a profession. Finally, though rare, barbarian tribes sometimes exhibit the same bond seen in a samurai, and so train their warriors with what can be viewed as a samurai code.

This article details the Samurai profession and the Shogun paragon path.

boardgame.name: Powers Beyond: Third Thrilling Supplement
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The third document to contain sensitive information critical to the survival of Earth 2081! This research and documentation covers everything from power-being origins to newly discovered weaknesses and skills as well as the power-beings themselves. Expanded information on organizations and more dual origins are contained within these pages. Part 3 of 5 for the Powers Beyond superheroic roleplaying game!
boardgame.rpg: Powers Beyond - A Superpowered Roleplaying Epic

boardgame.name: UkeSeme!: 2nd Expansion Card Set "Chaos Hen"
boardgame.description: This expansion pack adds 40 more cards to the original game. The theme on this expansion is chaotic personality characters, such as con men, mobsters, evil gods, and more.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: UkeSeme!: Sono Uke o Semeru no wa Ore da

boardgame.name: Too Broke to Rock
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You guessed it, your band has no money, and unfortunately you need to spend money, to make money in this business. So get to work if you want to compete in the next battle of the bands. This is the first adventure for the Laser Metal Pocket RPG, for characters level 1 and 2, and requires "Laser Metal" to play

boardgame.name: UkeSeme!: 1st Expansion Card Set "Iromono Hen"
boardgame.description: This is an expansion pack for the original UkeSeme! game that adds 40 new cards to the game. The new cards are various "イロモノ" (Iromono, a slang term for characters that are not as common tropes) to the game. Examples include "angel", "sword boy", or "omega".
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: UkeSeme!: Sono Uke o Semeru no wa Ore da

boardgame.name: Sherlock Fantasy: Felices para siempre
boardgame.description:
In each Q case, you try to solve a mystery case with 32 clues, with players revealing one clue at a time until all cards have been revealed or discarded.

Choose a card from your hand and place it on the table, so all players can read or see the entire information.
We recomend you read out loud all shared info when you place it on the table. If you play a clue that happens to be irrelevant to the case, you lose points at the end of the game, but be careful! Some clues are vital to resolve the case.

You can share and expose your theories at any moment and talk about the cards you have in your hand but you cannot show them to the other players and you may only read out loud the words written in bold or the text framed inside an image:

At the end of the game, when all clue cards have been revealed or discarded, you must check carefully all the available information and prepare a theory of what happened, working all together. Then, open the questionnaire and answer all questions. During this phase of the game, you can speak freely about your discarded cards, or the information you remember of them. Each right answer will add two points.

—user summary

¿Descubriréis qué ha ocasionado la muerte del joven más apuesto del reino?

—description from the back of the box

boardgame.name: The Mummy's Curse
boardgame.description:
What luck! While on holiday in Egypt, you and your friends find a cache of blood-red gems in the great pyramids of Giza. A souvenir for your mantelpiece, or a jewel to leverage into great wealth. But when you arise the following morning to go to your next tourist destination, you arise as a mummy!

-From the introduction

boardgame.name: Racekart Riot
boardgame.description:
The racers in Racekart Riot race off in hopes of winning the prized Ruby Cup! Armed with bananas, eggs, bombs, and more, the racers battle their way to first place. In this retro racing game, you don’t just win by coming in first place though, you must collect car and item cards in order to finish with style, earning you more points! When the race ends, the player with the most points wins the Ruby Cup and is crowned the champion!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: D&D Next Playtest (2013-10-14)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Final playtest rules for the 5th Edition of the world's greatest roleplaying game
...
This release of the D&D Next playtest presents updates to only the paladin and the druid. For convenience, this document still contains notes from the previous September 19 update.

As a reminder, you are looking at portions of the game, not the whole thing. Because of that fact, you might find things in the rules that are unclear or that refer to elements of the game that haven’t appeared in the public playtest. Please let us know through our surveys what works, what doesn’t work, what you don’t like, and what you like.

boardgame.name: Assault on Hunting Lodge Seven
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Agents of Edgewatch Adventure Path continues! Armed with the identity of a powerful Norgorber cultist belonging to the so-called Twilight Four, the agents infiltrate a soiree of alchemists and poisoners in order to apprehend the sinister Infector in his underground hideout. But before they can get their high-ranking criminal back to headquarters, foul weather and bureaucratic obstructions force them to hole up in the abandoned Hunting Lodge Seven, where they must barricade themselves against mysterious assailants and assassins intent on getting at their prisoner. Can the heroes stave off the assault long enough to see the Infector put behind bars? And what occult mysteries will they uncover when they pursue their next lead, a foray into the haunted old amusement park called Harrowland?

“Assault on Hunting Lodge Seven” is a Pathfinder adventure for four 12th-level characters. This adventure continues the Agents of Edgewatch Adventure Path, a six-part monthly campaign in which players take on the role of city watchdogs and dole out justice to Absalom's most nefarious criminals. This volume also includes new rules and inspiring details about the legends of the mysterious Harrow, tales of some of the countless mortals aspiring to divinity via the Test of the Starstone, and a mob of new monsters and villains for urban fantasy campaigns.

boardgame.name: Flight from Hall Manor
boardgame.description:
Flight from Hall Manor is a horror-themed escape style game played simultaneously in real-time. Players have 15 minutes to get through three levels of a haunted manor, searching for staircases and, ultimately, the way out.

Players act simultaneously, revealing cards as they move through doorways and rooms, avoiding traps, collecting items, fighting spectral predators, and surviving a fire spreading through the house.

Players can work cooperatively or take off alone and work to escape without the others. Variable character abilities, benefits for coop and solo play, and over 200 manor map combinations make the game different every time.

boardgame.name: Quizz Pyrénées
boardgame.description:
Quizz Pyrénées is a set of 110 cards / 550 questions gathered in 5 themes about the Pyrenees.
For each question, 5 clues, increasingly easy. The less question a player uses to answer, the more points he or she will score.
Whoever scores the most points at the end of the game will be crowned the "Best Pyrenean"
The themes are:

Fauna and flora
Unique landscapes
Heritage and traditions
Sports and leisure
Facts or characters in history

boardgame.name: Quizz Landes
boardgame.description:
Quizz Landes is a set of 110 cards / 550 questions gathered in 6 themes about the department of the Landes.
For each question, 5 clues, increasingly easy. The less question a player uses to answer, the more points he or she will score.
Whoever scores the most points at the end of the game will be crowned the "Best Landais"
The themes are:

Culture and traditions
Sports and leisure
Places and heritage
History and politics
Gastronomy and Crafts
Coastline and natural sites

boardgame.name: Charlotte Future City-Building Game
boardgame.description:
In this fun and easy game, 2-4 players each build their vision for the future of Charlotte. Players choose their objectives, what to build, and where to build it. The player with the best city wins the game! This game was built as a part of the Charlotte Future 2040 Comprehensive Plan public involvement process.

On your turn, a player takes two cards from the central play area. A player may take a Framework Policy card, which provides victory points for fulfilling its objectives; or a Place Type/Projects & Programs card to place in their city to meet Framework Policy objectives.

After a player selects their two cards, they discard a specified number of cards from the play area, based on the number of players. Empty spaces in the central play area are then filled with new cards. Play then proceeds clockwise.

The game ends after 11 rounds, or a total of 22 cards for each player. Players score their own Framework Policy cards and shared Bonus Point cards. The player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Kokopelli
boardgame.description:
Each player receives a 36 card deck, constructed from 3 each of 12 different ceremony cards (there are 16 different ceremonies in the base game).

Each player has a player board with spaces for four ceremonies. Their play area consists of the four spaces of their board, and the two nearest spaces on their left and right neighbors (for a total of 8 spaces). On a turn, they may draw a card, start a ceremony on personal player board, as long as there is not a ceremony of that type on in their play area; or play a card from their hand into any ceremony in their play area. Once started, a ceremony in your player grants a special ability until it is completed.

Ceremonies are complete after the fourth card is played to it, with the player claiming a victory point tile, and putting out a game end token if none is available. When all of the game end tokens have been put out the game ends. The player who has collected the most Victory Points is the winner.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Brothers at War: 1862
boardgame.description:
Brothers at War: 1862 is a quick-playing, tactical wargame exploring civil war brigade command. Units are regiments, batteries and companies of skirmishers. This is a quadrigame or set of four games, each featuring a full-size, 22x34" game map and covering battles from 1862:

Antietam, 5am-9am, September 17th
South Mountain, 9am-6pm, September 14th
Mill Springs, 7am-12pm, January 17th
Bloody Valverde, 10am-5pm, February 21st


Command rules are simple and abstracted. There are no combat results tables. Combat and all checks are resolved using six-sided dice, in which results of 5-6 mark success, and 1-4 failure. Brigades activate via chit pull, with their constituent units moving and fighting individually. Stacking is limited to two units per hex. Massive 1.5” hexes allow two 3/4” units to fit side by side… no information is obscured!

Distinctions are made between formed and unformed infantry, deployed and limbered artillery, mounted and dismounted cavalry. Unit facing is not an element of play. Instead, unit deployment in adjacent hexes can trigger pass-through fire, which simulates flanking fire, or fire on compressed lines (both dangerous situations for civil war units).

Battle Cards introduce an element of uncertainty and excitement to play. Unique off-map displays track every brigade's reserves and casualties. Once a unit's reserves are used up, it becomes exhausted and liable to break.

Product Information:
Complexity: Medium-High
Time Scale: 1 Turn = 20 Minutes
Map Scale: 100 yards/hex
Unit Scale: Regiments and Batteries

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Silent War + IJN (Second Edition)
boardgame.description:
Silent War and IJN, Deluxe 2nd Edition is an enhanced second edition of the original, award winning, game first published in 2005.

Silent War is a solitaire simulation of the United States' Navy submarine war against Imperial Japan in World War Two.
You serve as Commander of Submarines, US Pacific Fleet (ComSubPac).
Your mission is to deploy your boats with maximum effect to destroy Japanese shipping, while limiting your own submarine losses.

Featured scenarios cover actions ranging from famous short single sub patrols, through small campaigns of about a year of the war, ending with the grand campaign covering the entire Pacific War.
The game map breaks the Pacific into Operations Areas that subs move through as they patrol in search of Japanese shipping.

Special rules feature historical events that occurred during the war, ULTRA intelligence information reports, torpedo quality improvements, wolfpack capabilities, Super-Skippers, and many others.
Every US sub deployed in the Pacific is represented with its very own counter. All subs have been meticulously and accurately drawn, and shown from their side in full-color.

Bring added realism to your submarine campaign with IJN, Imperial Japanese Navy, originally released as the first expansion pack for Compass Games’ award winning Silent War. Every Japanese warship down through the large destroyer escorts and the major auxiliary cargo ships and tankers are provided in two full countersheets with 336 new playing pieces for the game and rules to integrate them seamlessly into the game. IJN, Imperial Japanese Navy also brings new rules to Silent War such as loners, crash dive, and targeting escorts, rules introduced in the follow on game, Steel Wolves.

This new edition includes the expansion, IJN that brings a greater depth of detail by providing all the major warships of the Imperial Japanese Navy.

This new edition features a mounted game board, consolidated rule book with all changes and improvements incorporated, a number of revised tables, additional scenarios not in the original game, and all the additional playing pieces that were added in the Steel Wolves game.

This new edition of Silent War/IJN is the definitive game on the United States Submarine Campaign against Imperial Japan.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Operation Crusader: The Winter Battles for Tobruk, 1941 – Designer Signature Edition
boardgame.description:
Operation Crusader, The Winter Battles for Tobruk, 1941 is played on a map of Libya and Egypt immediately south and east of Tobruk, where the battle was fought. It uses playing pieces that represent the actual military units that participated in this campaign. Each player represents the commander of the Axis or Allied forces. The individual ground units represent battalions of approximately 700 soldiers (50-60 tanks in an armored battalion, 12-24 guns in an artillery battalion), or companies of about 200 soldiers (15-20 tanks or armored cars in an armored company, 4-12 guns in an artillery battery). Each hex represents 2 kilometers or 1.25 miles. Each turn is a third of a day.

Operation Crusader is a two-player game, with team play possible for the full campaign game.
One player assumes the role of the Axis and the other player assumes the role of the Allies.
Each player moves his units and executes attacks on enemy units in turn, attempting to fulfill the game’s Victory Conditions.
To move from one space to another, each unit expends a portion of its Movement Allowance.
Combat is resolved through Battles by "firing" at opposing units and then determining the outcome of any hits scored. A die is used to resolve combat.

The classic monster game returns with a newly-streamlined game system throughout (no more pre-plotting movement!). This new edition emphasizes playability while capturing the flavor of the original game. The game adds smaller scenarios (6 total), each covering a shorter and smaller part of the historic battle, and a full campaign game which allows players to experience the full sweep of Operation Crusader. Two shorter versions of the entire campaign (the most exciting parts) are also included for those wanting less game play time.

Featured scenarios include:
• Scenario 1: Gabr Saleh (5 turns, 1 map), AM 19 Nov - PM 20 Nov
• Scenario 2: Bir El-Gobi (5 turns, 1 map), AM 19 Nov - PM 20 Nov
• Scenario 3: Sidi Rezegh (8 turns, 1 map), AM 21 Nov - PM 23 Nov
• Scenario 4: Storming the Frontier (8 turns, 1 map), AM 21 Nov - PM 23 Nov
• Scenario 5: Rommel's Dash (11 turns, 1 map), AM 24 Nov - PM 27 Nov
• Scenario 6: The Cauldron (8 turns, 2 maps), AM 24 Nov - PM 26 Nov
• "Short" Campaign Game (14 turns, all 4 maps), AM 19 Nov - PM 23 Nov
• "Long" Campaign Game (31 turns, all 4 maps), AM 19 Nov - PM 28 Nov
• "Extended" Campaign Game (50 turns, all 4 maps), AM 19 Nov - PM 5 Dec

—description from the publisher's website
